    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(java.lang.String name,
              PlayerColor color,
              Board board)
        Class constructor.
        Parameters:
        name - User chosen name, must be not null
        color - User chosen color
        board - The game board

      • Player

        public Player(Player player,
              boolean publicCopy)
        Copy constructor, creates an exact clone of a Player.
        Parameters:
        player - the Player to be cloned, has to be not null
        publicCopy - if true, a public copy of the Player will be created instead of a clone. The public copy will not contain the player's private information

                                boolean powerUp,
                                int num)

      • getPlayerRankings

        private java.util.List<PlayerColor> getPlayerRankings()
        Builds an list of unique PlayerColors who damaged this player. The list is ordered based on the points that each player should get as a reward.

        the list of PlayerColors

        public void addPowerUp(PowerUp powerUp)
                throws InvalidPowerUpException
        Adds a powerUp to the list of powerUps of this player.
        Parameters:
        powerUp - collected powerUp
        Throws:
        InvalidPowerUpException - thrown if a player already has 3 powerUps

      • addPowerUp

        public void addPowerUp(PowerUp powerUp,
                       boolean force)
                throws InvalidPowerUpException
        Adds a powerUp to the list of powerUps of this player.
        Parameters:
        powerUp - collected powerUp
        force - should ignore the powerup limit
        Throws:
        InvalidPowerUpException - thrown if a player already has 3 powerUps and force is false

                   throws InvalidPowerUpException
        Removes a powerUp from a player.
        Parameters:

        Throws:
        InvalidPowerUpException - thrown if the player does not own that powerUp

      • decrementKillScore

        private void decrementKillScore()
        Decrements a player's kill score. The killScore attribute can run below 1 in order to keep track of how many skulls to show on the player's dashboard. When evaluated, any kill score below 1 will count as 1.
